class_notes:
This course is designed to introduce biologists and computer scientists to basic bioinformatics principles, concepts, and techniques. By the end of this course, students will possess a bioinformatics skill set, including an informed vocabulary, sufficient for a productive collaboration within a multi-disciplinary research team.


Permission of instructor is required. Contact Professor Bromberg at ybrombe@emory.edu for permission.


Prerequisites: Biology 142, 142L, and 264.


Co-located with BIOL 485 and CS 485/4.
sections: Class Nbr: 5671, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: Y. Bromberg, Status: Open
